page.title: 01GATESHEAD AND NEWCASTLE
page.content: This area covers most of GATESHEAD and a small section of NEWCASTLE in the N.W. corner of the block.Gateshead is separated from Newcastle by the{ {River Tyne}which is crossed by six bridges within a very short distance, three of them carrying {rail}traffic into the{Central Station.} Not far from here stands the{Cathedral.}The north bank of the river farther downstream used to be very busy but{ {shipbuilding}is now in decline. Although there are areas of light industry,{Gateshead}is mainly residential with a large proportion of older or council owned property. However there are several areas where redevelopment is taking place. Gateshead's main claim to fame is its {international athletics stadium}which has built its reputation from nothing during the last six or seven years.
